title: Auto-relegated teams path to worlds.
body:
Hey guys and girls,

I have only recently gotten into the eSports scene since Worlds last year.
Watching the Spring splits this season, I was wondering if someone could explain to me what hope (if any) relegated teams have of making into worlds?
Or to rephrase, what paths to worlds are they from the challenger summer series? 

Thanks,
-Skyprus

replies.body:
Firstly, welcome to watching eSports! Summer Challenger teams CANNOT make worlds. Why? Because of the way you can get to worlds from an LCS. Each LCS (EU and NA) have 3 world's slots. The first is taken by the Summer Split winner. The second is by scoring the most Championship points. Championship points are gain by where you place in LCS in each split. The points are as follows.
 
Place	Spring Split	Summer Split
1st	        90	                Automatic Qualification
2nd	        70	                90
3rd	        50	                70
4th	        30	                40
5th-6th	10	                20
7th-10th	0	                0

The third spot is taken by gauntlet style, with the teams that score the 2nd-5th points. Example in link. http://na.lolesports.com/sites/default/files/styles/full_width_scale/public/qualifier.png?itok=MMV5R9fS

Since a relegated team cannot place first in the Summer Split, and is ineligible for points, they cannot make worlds. However, Spring Challenger teams can (For example, LMQ last year.)

Korea is pretty similar. Although the LCK is new this year (the setup was different last year, so i don't know how it works exactly)

China LPL has spring and summer splits. The 3 Spots are - the first is the winner of a Best of 3 between spring and summer champions (if it's the same team it's Auto Qualification) The other 2 spots are the 2 top teams in a tournament between the loser of the previous game, 2nd Spring Split, the 2nd and 3rd in the Summer Split. If the spring and summer split champions are the same, hence no loser, then the 4th team takes their spot and the seeding reorganises

The GPL (South East Asian region) gets 2 spots. The Summer Split champions Auto qualify and then points system similar to LCS

And finally the international wildcard teams win their regional tournament to qualify and then Riot makes it up.

Thanks so much for all the info!
